thread.title: Strictly Come Dancing's Ola Jordan Defends Sexy Calendars, Following Claims BBC Bosses Were Unhappy With Them
thread.title_full: Strictly Come Dancing's Ola Jordan Defends Sexy Calendars, Following Claims BBC Bosses Were Unhappy With Them

author: Ashley Percival
title: Strictly Come Dancing's Ola Jordan Defends Sexy Calendars, Following Claims BBC Bosses Were Unhappy With Them
text:
Previous Story Next Story Strictly Come Dancing's Ola Jordan Defends Sexy Calendars, Following Claims BBC Bosses Were Unhappy With Them The Huffington Post UK | By Ashley Percival 
Ola Jordan ’s raunchy calendars have been somewhat of a talking point recently, but the ‘ Strictly Come Dancing ’ professional has now spoken out to defend them. READ MORE: 
It had been claimed BBC bosses had told her to tone down her sexy image, but the star has stood by her decision to pose naked, having just unveiled her most revealing calendar yet . 
Ola Jordan 
"There's too much focus on the negative rather than the positive. I didn't even know if I'd be able to work again." 
Just one of the NSFW shots from Ola's 2016 calendar 
She added that reports the BBC had asked her to stop doing such photoshoots due to Strictly’s family-friendly reputation, were “rubbish”. 
"It's not on the show and it's not publicised by the show." 
Ola with husband James 
However, Ola’s return to ‘Strictly’ was dealt a blow when she became the first professional dancer to leave the competition, after her routines with partner Iwan Thomas failed to impress the judges and the voting public. 
‘Strictly Come Dancing’ continues on Saturday (24 October) on BBC One. Close
